Douglas Gatte Picchi

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/0629677573102326
  • Última atualização do currículo em 16/01/2019

He graduated from São Paulo State University (UNESP) in the stream of Biosciences in 2003. After the graduation he received further training during 2004-2005 in Biochemistry at the Faculty of Pharmacy at the UNESP and contributed in the investigation of some biochemical properties of polyphenoloxidase from spearmint. He obtained a master degree in Chemistry under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Vanderlan da Silva Bolzani at the Chemistry Institute of Araraquara (UNESP) and studied the cyclic peptides from Brazilian higher plants. In 2009 he received a scholarship from DAAD-CNPq to the Department of Biochemistry and Biology at the University of Potsdam (Germany) to continue his PhD under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Elke Dittmann. His work dealt with molecular microbial ecology focused on discovery of novel natural products from cyanobacterial field samples. In 2014, he moved back to Brazil and started a position as post-doctoral fellow at the São Paulo State University, Biosciences Institute of Coastal Campus of São Vicente (UNESP) sponsered by FAPESP (2014-2016) and further by the Young-researchers programm of the UNESP. Actually, he is working as Professor at the Ruy Barbosa Faculty in Salvador (Wyden Educacional). Besides teaching tasks, he is also currently working as acadmeic analist for the planinng and innovation office of ADTALEM Educacional do Brasil. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2014 - Atual
Microbial metagenomics for discovery of cryptic microviridin from Brazilian cyanobacterial blooms.
Descrição: Cyanobacteria have been recently rediscovered as proficient producers of bioactive secondary metabolites, particularly polyketides, alkaloids and peptides. Noteworthy are the cyclic peptides, as microviridins that form a new class of ribosomally synthesized depsipeptides, and whose intriguing tricyclic structure is unprecedented in nature. Due to their inhibitory activity against proteases, microviridins have a great potential for the treatment of diseases such as pulmonary emphysema, cystic fibrosis or infections. The family of cyanobacterial tricyclic peptides comprises thirteen variants, but data from environmental studies under the view of metagenomics suggest that the genetic diversity of microviridins is much larger than expected. In recent years metagenomics has been rapidly established as an efficient approach for discovery of new bioactive compounds independent of cultivation, which allows access to the genes of any sequence or function of a given environmental material. It offers modern techniques to characterize genes, biosynthetic gene clusters or even the metabolic profiles of complex samples, such as cyanobacterial blooms that hide an invaluable genetic variability, in many cases cryptic, for the production of bioactive secondary metabolites. Using a metagenomic mining approach to study a collection of environmental samples revealed a surprising variability of genes involved with the synthesis of microviridins expanding the natural library of these tricyclic peptides. Based on the use of the metagenomics approach applied to the chemical of natural products, this project aims the bioprospeccion of cryptic microviridins from Brazilian cyanobacterial blooms. Accessing the genetic heritage of this complex unknown biodiversity - quickly, efficiently and systematically ? assumes a key position in the era of metagenomics and promises elegantly to unravel and expand the natural metabolic library..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) .

Integrantes: Douglas Gatte Picchi - Coordenador / Wagner Vilegas - Integrante / Luiza Cortes - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Bolsa.
Número de produções C, T & A: 5 / Número de orientações: 2
2012 - Atual
Peptide biosynthesis in cyanobacteria: identification and characterisation of the biosynthetic gene clusters
Descrição: Aeruginoguanidine biosynthetic gene cluster has been only partially identified in the original producer strain M. aeruginosa Nies98 (unpublished data). Therefore, the objective of this study includes the complete sequencing of the missing agd biosynthetic gene cluster and the further in silico characterisation of the enzymes encoded in the cluster. Moreover, we planned to conducted empirical experiments towards the elucidation of the aeruginoguanidines biosynthetic pathway. We projected rational feeding experiments of the aeruginoguanidine producer M. aeruginosa PCC9806 with diverse isotopically labelled substrates aiming to gain more information about the biosynthetic origin of the aromatic unit of aeruginoguanidines. A final objective of this study regards the in vitro characterisation of two recombinant Agd enzymes. All together, the data will allow proposing a biosynthetic model for the production of aeruguinoguanidin, which it a step for further studies, as combinatorial biosynthesis..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) / Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Douglas Gatte Picchi - Integrante / WEIZ, A. - Integrante / ISHIDA, K. - Integrante / DITTMANN, E. - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico - Bolsa / Deutscher Akademischer Austauschdienst - Bolsa.
Número de produções C, T & A: 2 / Número de orientações: 1
2010 - 2013
Functional metagenomics for the identiﬁcation and isolation of bioactive peptides from cyanobacteria
Descrição: Microviridins belong to one of the most interesting families of depsipeptides from cyanobacteria1 and have been described for strains of the genera Microcystis, Planktothrix, Anabaena and Nostoc. Some of these tricyclic peptides were show to specifically inhibit serine-type proteases. The analysis of the gene cluster revealed that microviridins are synthesized from a ribosomal peptide precursor, which undergoes tailoring modifications, as the macrocyclization of the peptide backbone due to the activity of two ATP grasp-type ligases. The characteristic core motif for microviridins is the five amino acid sequence KYPSD; variations are primarily due to substitutions in the side chain. A screen of a collection of laboratory strains and field samples showed a global distribution of the microviridin gene cluster and an unprecedented variety2. Furthermore, the in silico analysis of complete genome has revealed the occurrence of microviridin-like gene clusters in various cyanobacterial genera, but the production of microviridin in all of these strains remains to be shown2. As the cloning of microviridin gene cluster of Mycrocystis was already described, we attempt to develop a suitable cloning process for strains of other cyanobacterial genera, like Planktothrix and Nodularia. This approach will allow the evaluation of the characteristics of the leader peptide used in the biosynthetic pathway of different microviridin-type peptides for heterologous expression in E. coli. A final goal of this work involves the metagenomic mining of cyanobacterial field samples aiming to extend the knowledge of the still unknown diversity of microviridin variants in natura..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Douglas Gatte Picchi - Coordenador / WEIZ, A. - Integrante / ISHIDA, K. - Integrante / HERTWECK, C. - Integrante / DITTMANN, E. - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Deutscher Akademischer Austauschdienst - Bolsa / Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico - Bolsa.
Número de produções C, T & A: 4 / Número de orientações: 1
2010 - Atual
in vitro reconstitution and further biochemical characterisation of the microviridin biosynthetic pathway
Descrição: Microviridins belong to one of the most interesting families of depsipeptides from cyanobacteria1 and have been described for strains of the genera Microcystis, Planktothrix, Anabaena and Nostoc. Some of these tricyclic peptides were show to specifically inhibit serine-type proteases. The analysis of the gene cluster revealed that microviridins are synthesized from a ribosomal peptide precursor, which undergo tailoring modifications, as the macrocyclization of the peptide backbone due to the activity of two ATP grasp-type ligases. The goals of this work regards the in vitro reconstitution of microviridin pathway as well as getting a more detailed understanding about the function of both macrocycle catalyzing enzymes (MvdC and MvdD). After establishing the in vitro conditions for the formation of lactone rings in the synthetic precursor peptide (MvdE), we aim (1) to mutate two essential lysine residues, which are known to be important for the ATP-binding and (2) to manipulate both ATP-Grasp ligases, constructing chimerical enzymes in order to investigate the catalytic differences between both enzymes..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Douglas Gatte Picchi - Integrante / WEIZ, A. - Integrante / ISHIDA, K. - Integrante / DITTMANN, E. - Coordenador / CHRISTIAN HERTWECK - Integrante.

Número de produções C, T & A: 2


Projetos de extensão
2003 - 2003
Prevenção também se ensina!
Descrição: Projeto desenvolvido junto às escolas públicas do município de Rio Claro/SP em caráter voluntário que visava a sensibilização dos alunos-participantes para a problemática das DSTs e como se prevenir. As atividades incluíram intervenções teóricas e lúdicas para a abordagem do tema de acordo com a faixa etária de cada ano escolar participante. O módulo de trabalho foi organizado em 5 horas de atividades para cada grupo trabalhado. O projeto surge independentemente no decorrer de estágio supervisionado em escolas públicas do curso de licenciatura em Ciências Biológicas..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Extensão.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) .

Integrantes: Douglas Gatte Picchi - Coordenador / Daniele Vital Vich - Integrante / Luiz Marcelo de Carvalho - Integrante.
2003 - 2003
DST e AIDS: o que você precisa saber!
Descrição: Projeto desenvolvido junto às escolas públicas do município de Rio Claro/SP em caráter voluntário. As atividades incluíram intervenções teóricas e lúdicas para a abordagem; projeto desenvolvido principalmente em ensino de adultos (supletivo). O módulo de trabalho foi organizado em palestras/atividades de 2 horas para cada grupo trabalhado. O projeto surge independentemente no decorrer de estágio supervisionado em escolas públicas do curso de licenciatura em Ciências Biológicas..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Extensão.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) .

Integrantes: Douglas Gatte Picchi - Coordenador / Daniele Vital Vich - Integrante / Luiz Marcelo de Carvalho - Integrante.
2001 - 2003
Orquidário de portas abertas
Descrição: A curadoria do orquidário do Instituto de Biociências abre seu acervo para visitação guiada para alunos de ensino básico de escolas públicas e privadas do município de Rio Claro..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Extensão.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) .

Integrantes: Douglas Gatte Picchi - Integrante / Renata Giassi Udulutsch - Integrante / Antonio Furlan - Coordenador.

Outras informações relevantes

 
1) Responsible for the ideation, assembly and organization of "Molecular Microbiology Laboratory" with emphasis on the study of natural products of cyanobacteria (Emblem: "Cyanobacteria molecular goes," CyanoMol) by implementing new line of research on functional metagenomics of cyanobacteria. Laboratory implementation process included (1) purchase and installation of countertops and cabinets, (2) acquisition of equipment imported and domestic, as well as all (3) consumables needed to carry out the current research line in progress in the CLP.

2) Aprovado em 2° lugar no concurso público estadual (Edital nº 09/2017-STDARH - IB/CLP) para provimento de um professor substituto para as disciplinas "Química" e "Química geral".

3) Aprovado em 2° lugar no concurso público estadual (Edital nº 04/2017-STDARH - IB/CLP) para provimento de um professor substituto para as disciplinas "Biologia molecular", "Evolução" e "Bioquímica metabólica".

4) Aprovado em 6° lugar no concurso público estadual (Edital nº 49/2015-STAAd - CLP) para provimento de um professor doutor (RDIDP) para as disciplinas "Genética geral", "Genética molecular" e "Biologia molecular".

5) Aprovado em 1° lugar no concurso público municipal (Processo seletivo 001/2007) para provimento de um professor nível II para a disciplina "Ciências".

6) Founder-member of the study-group "Molecular biology applied to natural products - BioPN" at the Institute of Chemistry in Araraquara. From March till November 2006, 2 hours weekly. The meetings were organised by members seminars and discussion of current literature.
